alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 09 at 4:50AM EDT until June 09 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CAMDEN...NORTHWESTERN BURLINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN BUCKS AND EAST CENTRAL PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 449 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mount Laurel, or 9 miles east of Camden, moving east at 40 mph. This storm produced a wind gust of 54 mph at Philadelphia International Airport. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Cherry Hill, Bensalem, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Voorhees, Medford, Lindenwold, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Riverside, Berlin, Palmyra, Magnolia and Beverly. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 6A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 355 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 26 and 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 31 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
